name: Filipino Baked Milkfish (Baked Bangus)
author: lola
summary: This Filipino fish dish is very easy to prepare. The only time-consuming and challenging part is cleaning the fish.
ingredients: 2 pounds whole milkfish (bangus), or more to taste
1 (2 inch) piece ginger, thinly sliced crosswise, or to taste, divided
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line a roasting pan with enough aluminum foil to cover the whole bangus
Remove scales and gills from bangus
Pat fish dry with a paper towel
Mix tomato, onion, and 1/3 of the ginger together in a bowl
Cut open the front side of the fish and fill with the tomato mixture
Place fish in the prepared pan
Mix calamansi juice, soy sauce, garlic, and remaining ginger in a separate bowl
Pour over the fish in the pan
Fold foil over the fish and seal all ends
Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 60 minutes
